summary: This bill, the Rural Veterans’ Improved Access to Benefits Act of 2025, aims to improve temporary licensure requirements for healthcare professionals contracted by the Department of Veterans Affairs who conduct medical disability examinations. It amends the Veterans’ Benefits Improvements Act of 1996 and the Johnny Isakson and David P. Roe, M.D. Veterans Health Care and Benefits Improvement Act of 2020. Key changes include expanding the definition of eligible healthcare professionals, delaying the sunset provision related to these temporary licenses, and requiring the Secretary of Veterans Affairs to submit a report detailing the use and effectiveness of the program.
